Translation: they saw them; they had seen them
you (pl) used to sleep, you (pl) were sleeping
we nodded our heads; we bowed our heads
he/she received it/them (long ago); he/she had received it/them
they captured you (pl) (long ago); they had captured you (pl)
I customarily eat things, I customarily eat
you (sg) used to carry it/them on your back; you (sg) were carrying it/them on your back
I carry s.th., I carry things
I see s.o., I see people
I see s.th., I see things.
it says itself; i.e., it is said
he scrapes s.th. (e.g., the heart of the maguey plant)
I scratch my back (against a wall, a post, etc.)
he toasts s.th. (maize kernels, peas, etc.) on a comal
he toasts s.th. (maize kernels, peas, etc.) on a comal
I see it (animate or nonanimate); I see them (nonanimate)
it is fleeing hither, it is bounding in this direction
I am knowledgeable thither; i.e., I know how to get there, I know the way there
I am knowledgeable thither; i.e., I know how to get there, I know the way there
he will go and overtake s.o.
we used to go to see them
I am going to see him/her/it (Or if the object is nonanimate: it/them.)
we customarily send him thither as a messenger
I am going to see him/her/it.
he exited, he has exited, he will have exited
he was bounding away/fleeing, he has been fleeing
he/she drank it, he/she has drunk it
he/she counted it/them, he/she has counted it/them
I didn't cry, I haven't cried
they didn't die, they haven't died
you (pl) have not thrown it hither
I am sleeping. I am falling asleep.
If only I may sleep. Would that I sleep. I hope I can sleep.
If only he had counted them (but he didn't).
I hope they are not asleep
If only I had not fallen asleep. If only I had not slept. I wish I had not been sleeping.
Please still look; i.e., Please pay attention for a moment.
Have him reach hither; i.e., Have him approach.
Let's have fun for yet a while. Let's enjoy ourselves a little longer.
Let them beware of shouting.  They must be careful not to shout. Etc.
Beware of falling. Be careful of falling. Take care lest you fall. Watch out lest you fall. Watch out you don't fall. Etc.
Let's beware of falling. We must be careful not to fall.
Let him beware of fleeing. He must be careful not to flee. He mustn't flee. Etc.
Beware (pl) of fleeing. Be (pl) careful not to flee. Etc.
Let me beware of eating. Etc.
Don't beware of leaving; i.e., Be sure to leave. Be careful you leave.
Let him not beware of carrying it; i.e., Let him be sure to cany it. He should by all means carry it.  Etc.
I knew s.th.; I found s.th. out
we knew s.th.; we found s.th. out
let them beware of knowing it
I had known s.th.; I had found s.th. out
I used to stand; I stood; I had been standing; I had stood; I will have stood
I am lying down, I am recumbent
we are lying down, we are recumbent
I used to be recumbent/lying down; I was recumbent/lying down; I had been recumbent/lying down
it used to be hanging; it hung; it had been hanging
what is it like? how is it? [traditionally written quenami]
how fortunate I am! [Quēn mach is traditionally written solid as quēmmach]

Analysis: you are not just anyhow, i.e.,you are marvelous
